etymology.description: Pictogram: a person escaping from a flood; original form of 逃; later phonetically borrowed to mean “omen”.
etymology.interpretation: Originally a drawing of someone fleeing rising water, it wrote the verb ‘escape’. It was later borrowed by sound to write the unrelated word for ‘omen’, while Shuowen reinterpreted the picture as divination cracks.

examples.chinese: 乌云是暴雨的征兆(烏雲是暴雨的徵兆)。
examples.english: Dark clouds are a sign of a heavy rainstorm.

examples.chinese: 这些症状是病情恶化的先兆(這些症狀是病情惡化的先兆)。
examples.pinyin: Zhèxiē zhèngzhuàng shì bìngqíng èhuà de xiānzhào.
examples.english: These symptoms are a precursor of the illness worsening.

examples.chinese: 古人见到日食常把它当作不祥之兆(古人見到日食常把它當作不祥之兆)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔrén jiàndào rìshí cháng bǎ tā dàngzuò bùxiáng zhī zhào.
examples.english: The ancients often regarded a solar eclipse as an ill omen.
